questions.Question: Which of the following cannot be done with document version?
questions.solution: Solution:		None of the above cannot be done with document version. The Versions feature in Word was removed in recent versions of Word. In Word 2013, the only way you can access previous versions of a document in Word is to open previous automatically saved (autosaved) versions of the document. You can also open recent unsaved documents. However, there is no formal versioning feature in Word. We will show you an alternative you can easily add to Word for free that will provide this capability.

questions.Question: What does EXT indicator on status bar of MS Word indicate?

If we press any arrow keys at that point the text will be selected from the anchor point. The Status Bar indicates that we are in Extend Selection mode. questions.Question: Which of the following is not essential component to perform a mail merge operation?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are three components of a Mail Merge: The main document controls the merge. It contains the fixed information that will be in every letter and the merged codes where the variable text will be. The data source is a document or database that contains the information that will be different for each letter.Remember, the data source is usually the names and addresses.It can be stored in a table in Word, an Excel Spreadsheet or a table in Access. The merged document is the result of a merge. These are the individual letters that result from the merge. The merge fields are replaced with the actual data from the Data Source file.

questions.Question: To verify that the note text is positioned correctly on the page, switch to _____ view or display the document in print preview.
questions.solution: Solution:		Print layout provides us with a view of the document where we can see page breaks and other features, as well as the basic character and paragraph formatting. This is helpful when we want to see where text ends on a page or where paragraphs break over two pages.

questions.Question: Which of the following is true regarding page Orientation of a Document?
questions.optionA: Page Orientation can be changed at any time
questions.optionB: Page Orientation of document determines by printer
questions.optionC: Page Orientation must be set before start typing
questions.optionD: Page Orientation of a document cannot be changed.
questions.solution: Solution:		Word allows us to create documents with pages that are in landscape or portrait view. We can change the orientation any time you want but it applies to every single page in a document. There is no option to change the page orientation for a single page in MS Word.

questions.Question: Which feature helps you to inserts the contents of the Clipboard as text without any formatting
questions.solution: Solution:		Paste Special feature helps US to inserts the contents of the Clipboard as text without any formatting. To invoke Paste Special - Home > Paste > Paste Special or CTRL+ALT+V.

questions.Question: When Word flags a possible spelling or grammar error, it also changes the mark on the Spelling and Grammar Status icon to a ________.
questions.solution: Solution:		If we typed a word not in the dictionary (misspelled or proper name), a wavy red line appears.Word flags a possible error and changes the Status icon to a red X.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a font style?
questions.solution: Solution:		A superscript is a character, symbol or number set slightly above the normal line of text. It is always smaller than the usual font and is typically found in mathematical or scientific formulas. it is effects to the font.

questions.Question: How can you remove tab stop markers from ruler?
questions.optionA: Double click the tab marker and choose Clear All
questions.optionB: Drag the tab stop marker out of the ruler
questions.optionC: Right click the tab stop marker and choose remove
questions.solution: Solution:		The easiest way to change and remove tab stops is to work with them directly on the Ruler. We can drag a tab stop to the right or left to shift its position, or we can drag it off the Ruler entirely (up or down) to remove it. To change a tab stop’s type, double-click the tab stop on the Ruler to open the Tabs dialog box and make our changes there.

questions.Question: When sharing data in Office, the ________ document is the document in which the data was first entered.
questions.solution: Solution:		A source document is a document in which data collected for a clinical trial is first recorded.

questions.Question: The ability to combine name and addresses with a standard document is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		The automatic addition of names and addresses from a database to letters and envelopes in order to facilitate sending mail, especially advertising, to many addresses.

questions.Question: Which enables us to send the same letter to different persons?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mail Merge is a useful tool that allows us to produce multiple letters, labels, envelopes, name tags, and more using information stored in a list, database, or spreadsheet.

questions.Question: A word processor would most likely be used to do
questions.optionA: Keep an account of money spent
questions.optionB: Do a computer search in media center
questions.solution: Solution:		A word processor, or word processing program, does exactly what the name implies. It is used to manipulate a text document, such as a resume or a report. We typically enter text by typing, and the software provides tools for copying, deleting and various types of formatting. So in given options it would most likely be used to do type a biography.

questions.Question: What is gutter margin?
questions.optionA: Margin that is added to the left margin when printing
questions.optionB: Margin that is added to right margin when printing
questions.optionC: Margin that is added to the binding side of page when printing
questions.optionD: Margin that is added to the outside of the page when printing
questions.solution: Solution:		The gutter margin is a typographical term used to designate an additional margin added to a page layout to compensate for the part of the paper made unusable by the binding process. In a facing pages layout (Word refers to this type of layout as "mirror margins"), the gutter margin is on the very inside of both pages.

questions.Question: Which can be used for quick access to commonly used commands and tools?
questions.solution: Solution:		In Word 2003, Tool bar is used for quick access to commonly used commands and tools.

questions.Question: A character that is raised and smaller above the baseline is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		A superscript is a number, figure, symbol, or indicator that is smaller than the normal line of type and is set slightly above it.

questions.Question: Selecting text means, selecting ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Selecting text means, selecting a word or an entire sentence or a whole document.

questions.Question: MS-Word automatically moves the text to the next line when it reaches the right edge of the screen and is called?
questions.solution: Solution:		Word wrap is a word processing feature that forces all text to be confined within defined margins. When a line of text is filled, the word processor automatically moves the text to the next line, so the we do not have to press the return key after every line.

questions.Question: In MS-Word, for what does ruler help?
questions.solution: Solution:		In Microsoft Word Ruler helps to set tabs, to change a line's indentation, click and hold the bottom bar, then, drag it left to decrease the indentation, or right to increase it. If we want to adjust the hanging or first line indent, drag the up and down arrows left or right. It also help to to change page margins.

questions.optionC: AutoCorrect can only accommodate one line of text. It is not possible to convert a symbol or multiple lines of text into an AutoCorrect entry.
questions.optionD: Insert the symbol or type the text in a Word document first. Then, select the text or symbol and click the Edit menu followed by Paste Special. Select New AutoCorrect Entry and then click OK.

questions.Question: To update a formula in a table, press the
questions.solution: Solution:		F9: Update a field. This is the same as right-clicking a field and choosing the “Update Field” command. Alt + F9: Toggle the display of a field’s code. Shift + F9: Reveal a field’s code. F8: Enter Word’s selection mode and expand a selection.

questions.Question: To move the cursor page to page of documents.
questions.solution: Solution:		Ctrl + Page Down and Ctrl + Page Up move the cursor up and down one page at a time.

questions.Question: The word wrap feature ________
questions.optionA: Automatically moves text to the next line when necessary
questions.optionB: Appears at the bottom of the document
questions.optionC: Allows you to type over text
questions.optionD: Is the short horizontal line indicating the end of the document
questions.solution: Solution:		Word wrap is a word processing feature that forces all text to be confined within defined margins. When a line of text is filled, the word processor automatically moves the text to the next line, so the we do not have to press the return key after every line.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used to create newspaper style columns?

questions.optionB: Auto text option from Insert menu

questions.Question: What is the default number of lines to drop for drop cap?
questions.solution: Solution:		A drop cap is a large capital letter at begin of a paragraph that, typically, has the depth of two or more lines of normal text. It is set to '3' by default, although any choice from 2 onwards.

questions.Question: A bookmark is an item or location in document that you identify a name for future Reference. Which of the following task is accomplished by using bookmarks?
questions.optionA: To mark the ending of a page of document
questions.optionB: To quickly jump to a specific location in the document
questions.optionC: To add hyperlinks in a web page
questions.solution: Solution:		Bookmark in MS Word is a specific word, section, or location in our Word document that we want to name and identify for future reference. For example, let's say we need to identify a text, a number we want to revise at a later time. With the use of bookmarks, there is no need of scrolling through the document in order to find the text. Just use the bookmark, and we can quickly and easily jump to the text.

questions.Question: What is the maximum number of lines you can set for a drop cap?
questions.solution: Solution:		For a drop cap maximum number of lines 10 and minimum number of line 1 can be set. By default it is 3.

questions.Question: How can you insert a sound file in your word document?
questions.solution: Solution:		In word 2003 and earlier versions from insert > object menu option a sound file can be inserted in our word document. In word 2007 and higher version from Insert > Text > Object option a sound file can be inserted in our word document.

questions.Question: Macros are:
questions.optionA: Small programs created in MS-Word to automate repetitive tasks by using VBA
questions.optionB: Small add-on programs that are installed afterwards if you need them
questions.optionC: Programming language that you can use to customize MS-Word
questions.optionD: Large tools in Word such as mail merge
questions.solution: Solution:		A macro can help improve efficiency when creating documents and spreadsheets, adding or maintaining information, or creating forms for other people to fill out. Microsoft Word and Excel are popular software in which people utilize macros to make data entry and retention easier. Macros in Word and Excel are created using the Visual Basic programming language or by recording actions performed.
